rComments: A great prof. He tells a lot of funny anecdotes and does a good job of explaining Canadian history. He makes you connect to it on a personal level by mentioning how Toronto was back in the day.

Professor Penfold is perhaps the most influential figure of my tenure at UofT. He was able to take terribly dry content and make it both understandable and comical. The assignments for this class were somewhat challenging, however, his lectures were so compelling that studying for the exam was more of a fond reminiscing of truly exciting lectures.

Penfold was funny, informative, and entertaining. I learned a lot & Penfold brought  a lot of life to  some  very dry material. I visited Penfold during office hours just to shoot the breeze and I found him very approachable. He is a great prof. You don't realize how great UofT profs are until you attend another university.

Penfold's best quality is that he's funny during lectures and manages to keep potentially dry material interesting. Didn't have much direct interaction with him in 263, but in 365 he was my tutorial leader. I realized he's actually pretty grumpy and unapproachable most of the time. His grading is a bit tougher than average. Overall not a bad prof.
Made the material far more interesting by bringing a sense of humour.

Interesting professor and good critical thinker, but class discussion was VERY disorganized. Somewhat strict grader considering it was a seminar (i.e. there's no grading curve); HIS484 had noticeably stricter marking than other 400-level HIS courses. Good, but I'd recommend him for lectures, not seminars, as he was awful at directing discussion.

Very enthusiastic about the material, which makes it easier to actually stay in class and listen. Material was dry but he made it bearable - I actually went to class! He is a great prof for keeping students interested in what could be called dull material by many.

His unabashedly intolerant left wing slant is insufferable. I don't mind the slant in other professors per se. If Penfold possessed the striking brilliance of Rick Halpern or the charm of Michael Wayne -- both his political blood brothers -- I could forgive the fact that he uses his professorial podium as a soapbox. Unfortunately, he has neither.
Prof respected all students' comments during class, but seemed to be working to rule outside class hours. So yeah, he's not particularly approachable - even during office hours.
Clear and organized lectures. Mostly approachable, but not always. Compulsively injects personal commentary into lectures and seems to think that everyone agrees. Overall I was semi-impressed.
No Comments

Who would have thought Canadian history could be so interesting?  Penfold is hilarious and very organized in his lectures.  He should teach the whole class and boot Silver out. Bonus: Hes hot. Warning, the tut's in this class are worth a big chunk of your mark and are on a weekly basis, a bit of a pain.
I love his nerdy charm... and his ability to superimpose maps! He's an awesome lecturer, and a completely brilliant person.
Awesome professor and his humour is appreciated

"Steve" is refreshingly enthusiastic about Canadian History; really brought it to life!! I actually felt patriotic after leaving the course.  Humour sophomoric at times, but otherwise wonderfully funny & engaging while also keeping standards high.  Organized, consistent, reliable, encouraged comments and questions.  Highly recommend this course!!
he's a nice guy and his lectures are clear enough, but his humour is sophomoric and he doesn't treat his subjects in any depth.

Amazing. One of the best profs i have had in my 3 years. i had serious doubts about cdn history before taking the course but with penfold and silver tag teaming, the course was probabaly the best taught course i have had to date. High school style format for marks (small low percentage assignments) make the course very forgiving.
AWESOME PROF! Did his PhD dissertation on "The Significance of the doughnut in Canadian Society" have my respect. Keeps the lectures knowledgeable and humorous. Great class!

Fantastic Prof.  Loved the course because he brought life to the history of Canada.  Loved his jokes and willingness to help students if they had any questions.  Don't like the changes in exam format though.

taught second half of the course and TA'd. very good at both, best tutorial i've been in. tries to interject self-depricating humour into everything! very clear lectures and outlines, likes to talk about his family. great prof, great course!
Treats students like people.  Great atmosphere in class, encourages you to say what you think.  Great prof.
best prof at u of t
Best prof. in history of life
Lectures were entertaining.  Loved his perspective on Canadian history.  Helpful and humorous.  Tutorials were well run.
